chargeHist.descr: Failure to Comply with Officer's Attempt to Take Person into Custody

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A. Hanson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Comply With Officer's Attempt to Take Person into Custody [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.415(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
Defendant has 5 days credit if revoked from Probation.

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations.

timeConds.notes: With Huber or electronic monitoring if the jail deems it appropriate. All stayed pending further order of the court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Failure to Comply With Officer's Attempt to Take Person into Custody
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert A. Hanson

records.addlTxt: Notice of right to seek postconviction relief
Time to Pay Summary mailed to defendant. JOC sent via email to jail.

2:30 pm case called. Defendant Robert A. Hanson in court.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Robert A. Hanson.  Prosecuting attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
There is an agreement which the Defense recites. Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 5 as charged in the Information. 
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts plea, finds the defendant Guilty and orders anything else dismissed and read in.  
Court withholds sentencing and places the defendant on Probation for 2 years with conditions:
90 days in jail with Huber/EM at the discretion of the jail- all jail stayed pending further order of the Court. 
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Defendant to pay court costs including the DNA sample. 
Defendant has 5 days credit if revoked from Probation.
Status conference on October 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

9:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert A. Hanson in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Cook appeared by video for Robert A. Hanson. 

Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. 

Case referred to Judge Barna for scheduling.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:34 PM.
Defendant Robert A. Hanson in court, in custody with Public Defender Intern Clayton Cavanaugh and supervising Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Robert A. Hanson. Attorney Loralee Clark appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.
State calls Officer Mark Vang to the stand. He is sworn and testifies. Cross examination by Clayton Cavanaugh. Witness excused.
Counsel argues probable cause. Defense motions to dismiss Count 1 due to lack of probable cause shown. Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over.
Arraignment scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Added Count 5- Failure to Comply with Officer's Attempt to Take Person into Custody.

Case called at 9:35 AM.
Prosecuting Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert A. Hanson in court, in custody with Attorney Karl Schmidt for Attorney Katherine Cook.
Attorney Schmidt requests the matter be set for Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward
